children.subject: I'm assuming you're in the class right now? You should really ask this question in that class's Piazza and I'll happily answer it there. I'm taking the class right now too.
Mostly looking for more lecture material and homeworks. I didn't take 132/120 :/
I hope I'm not hijacking this thread, but can I ask for some advice on 131? Studying, and learn about vehicle dynamics? There are parts of the class where I can't seem to find many resources for.

I haven't taken 162 but have taken 149, and would agree that the latter doesn't go into enough depth on certain topics. Scheduling and interrupts, in particular, are two topics that were covered at a conceptual level but the practical implementation wasn't really discussed. 162 seems like it covers the practical details of those topics a little better, but I don't have experience with it myself.

history.content:
I'm hoping that a professor like @Anant Sahai @Sanjit Seshia or @Edward Lee could comment on my question.

I'm really interested in taking 149, and not particularly interested in 162, but I get a general feel that not taking 162 is like shooting myself in the foot, and don't really understand how and to what degree the courses differ.

So far, the courses I've enjoyed the most have been EE120, EE123, EE128, EECS C106A, ME131 (Vehicle Dynamics and Controls). So, my focus has been a mix of SP and controls. I have 2 more semesters left at Cal, and want to try some Data Science classes and a mix of CS161, CS168, and CS186 if I can fit them in, and plan to take EE192 Spring 2019. Career-wise, I want to end up at the intersection of software and engineering, ideally working in controls or applications engineering, but I also want to be versatile enough to work in software, closer to the data acquisition and analysis side of things. I consider myself at the center of both EE/CS in terms of my interests.

Does 149 seem like a worthwhile course for me, or might 162 round me out better by the time I leave Cal? The topics in 149 seem interesting, and from what I can tell from the schedules/syllabi of both classes, there is some overlap between them. But, I get the impression that 149 doesn't delve deep enough into many of its topics.

Would really appreciate some guidance here. I've read all the other posts about 149 on this piazza, but nothing has really touched on the points I'm interested in so I'm hoping I could gain some further clarity here. Thanks!
history.subject: EECS149 and CS162: Where do the classes differ?
